perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, XIMAGE and MORPHO have signed the "ForceField PSS Agreement" for the purchase of services and the use of Software referred to hereafter as the ForceField PSS System.
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, XIMAGE and MORPHO have signed the "ForceField PSS Agreement" for the purchase of services and the use of Applications referred to hereafter as the ForceField PSS System.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Software' to 'Applications' introduces ambiguity. The contract later defines 'PROGRAM' which includes 'ForceField PSS software'. It's now unclear if 'Applications' is synonymous with 'PROGRAM' or refers to something else, creating confusion about the scope of maintenance.

perturbation.original_text: XIMAGE will provide to MORPHO during the term hereof "Software      Maintenance Services" which shall include remedial maintenance service      (i.e, error fixing and/or work arounds) for any significant error,      malfunction or defect (collectively in "Error") in the Software so that      the Software will operate in accordance with the specifications set      forth in the related documentation.
perturbation.changed_text: XIMAGE will provide to MORPHO during the term hereof "System Maintenance Services" which shall include remedial maintenance service (i.e, error fixing and/or work arounds) for any significant issue, malfunction or defect (collectively in "Error") in the System so that the System will operate in accordance with the specifications set forth in the related documentation.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Software Maintenance Services' to 'System Maintenance Services' and 'Software' to 'System', we create uncertainty. The contract focuses on 'Software' in its definition of 'PROGRAM'. Now, there's a question of whether 'System' encompasses just the software, or the hardware and network as well, impacting the scope of XIMAGE's maintenance obligations.

perturbation.original_text: XIMAGE hereby indemnifies and agrees to hold MORPHO harmless from any      claim of any third party that any of the Software infringes any United      States patent, copyright, trademark or other property right held by a      third party provided that XIMAGE is notified promptly by MORPHO of any      such claim (including any threatened claim) and XIMAGE shall have had      sole control of the defense with respect to same (including the      settlement of such claim).
perturbation.changed_text: XIMAGE hereby indemnifies and agrees to hold MORPHO harmless from any claim of any third party that any of the Program infringes any United States patent, copyright, trademark or other intellectual property right held by a third party provided that XIMAGE is notified promptly by MORPHO of any such claim (including any threatened claim) and XIMAGE shall have had sole control of the defense with respect to same (including the settlement of such claim).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'property right' to 'intellectual property right'. The original text says 'Software infringes any United States patent, copyright, trademark or other property right'. This has now been updated to 'Program infringes any United States patent, copyright, trademark or other intellectual property right held'. The conflict is in the fact that 'property right' could include physical property damage whereas 'intellectual property right' means physical damages would not be protected.
